question.title: Investments in 2016
question.content:
Write a query to print the sum of all total investment values in 2016 (TIV_2016), to a scale of 2 decimal places, for all policy holders who meet the following criteria:

Have the same TIV_2015 value as one or more other policyholders.
Are not located in the same city as any other policyholder (i.e.: the (latitude, longitude) attribute pairs must be unique).
Input Format:
The insurance table is described as follows:

| Column Name | Type          |
|-------------|---------------|
| PID         | INTEGER(11)   |
| TIV_2015    | NUMERIC(15,2) |
| TIV_2016    | NUMERIC(15,2) |
| LAT         | NUMERIC(5,2)  |
| LON         | NUMERIC(5,2)  |
where PID is the policyholder's policy ID, TIV_2015 is the total investment value in 2015, TIV_2016 is the total investment value in 2016, LAT is the latitude of the policy holder's city, and LON is the longitude of the policy holder's city.

Sample Input

| PID | TIV_2015 | TIV_2016 | LAT | LON |
|-----|----------|----------|-----|-----|
| 1   | 10       | 5        | 10  | 10  |
| 2   | 20       | 20       | 20  | 20  |
| 3   | 10       | 30       | 20  | 20  |
| 4   | 10       | 40       | 40  | 40  |
Sample Output

| TIV_2016 |
|----------|
| 45.00    |
Explanation

The first record in the table, like the last record, meets both of the two criteria.
The TIV_2015 value '10' is as the same as the third and forth record, and its location unique.

The second record does not meet any of the two criteria. Its TIV_2015 is not like any other policyholders.

And its location is the same with the third record, which makes the third record fail, too.

So, the result is the sum of TIV_2016 of the first and last record, which is 45.

rephrased.body:
Write a query to print the sum of all total investment values in 2016 (TIV_2016), rounded to 2 decimal places, for all policy holders who satisfy these conditions:

1.  There exists at least one other policyholder with the same TIV_2015 value.
2.  The policyholder's location, defined by the (latitude, longitude) pair, is unique compared to all other policyholders.

testcases.explanation: Policyholder 1 meets the criteria: TIV_2015 (10) is shared with policyholders 3 and 4, and the location (10, 10) is unique. Policyholder 4 also meets the criteria: TIV_2015 (10) is shared with policyholders 1 and 3, and the location (40, 40) is unique. Policyholder 2 fails the first condition since no other policyholder shares the same TIV_2015 value. Policyholder 3 fails the second condition since Policyholder 2 shares the same location.  Therefore, the sum of TIV_2016 for policyholders 1 and 4 is 5 + 40 = 45, formatted to two decimal places.
